content:
I posted an issue and a PR last week asking to take over as maintainer of the Token Filter module. Could one of the Powers please wave the magic wand (or if I missed an important step, let me know what I missed)? TiA!

Take over as maintainer of Token Filter module · Issue #492 · backdrop-ops/contrib
Per this issue, I would like to take over as maintainer of the Token Filter module. Here's the associated PR.
Fix bugs, take over as maintainer by bugfolder · Pull Request #4 · backdrop-contrib/token_filter
This PR addresses this issue. I'm also requesting to be made a maintainer (with the approval of the original maintainer) and have listed myself as maintainer in the README.
@bugfolder I think the wait time is 2 weeks?
@klonos would know this better
According to the docs there's a wait time of 2 weeks if the maintainer doesn't respond, but in this case, the maintainer has already responded with agreement.
Looks like I don't have permission to the project otherwise I'd add @bugfolder (in my role as Bug Squad member). @klonos or @jenlampton can you fix the permissions?

I can fix the permissions. Where has the maintainer responded? I don't see any comments on https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/492

Take over as maintainer of Token Filter module · Issue #492 · backdrop-ops/contrib
Per this issue, I would like to take over as maintainer of the Token Filter module. Here's the associated PR.

Aha, found it https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/token_filter/issues/3#issuecomment-771783612

Call to nonexistent function token_get_entity_mapping() · Issue #3 · backdrop-contrib/token_filter
On line 39 of token_filter.module, there is a call to token_get_entity(). If this point is reached in the code, the module crashes because that function doesn't exist in the Backdrop version of...
@bugfolder okay, you're the new maintainer! Thank you :)
Does backdrop have any support for custom tokens right now?

Yes. All tokens that don't need context currently work in Token Filter module, and Backdrop has the same support for creating custom tokens that Drupal did; you just implement hook_token_info() and hook_tokens(), both of which are documented in the api. See User Time Zone Tokens for a recent example of creating custom tokens in a module.
If you install Token Help, you can easily see all the tokens that are currently available. (Token help doesn't add any tokens; it just makes it easier to see the existing ones.)
Thank you. There is no custom token model that gives UI access to creating custom tokens at the moment. Correct?
If not, Ill look into having someone make one on my team.

If there's a D7 module that creates the custom tokens, porting the D7 module would be something to look into. I've ported a bunch of D7 modules to Backdrop, and it's often been quick and easy. Coder Upgrade module even does most of the porting work for you.

There is no custom token model that gives UI access to creating custom tokens at the moment. Correct?

Correct.
